title: partialwrap: Wrappers of external executables and Python functions for functools.partial

creators.affiliation: Institut National de Recherche pour l'Agriculture, l'Alimentation et l'Environnement - INRAE, Nancy, France
creators.name: Matthias Cuntz

description:
partialwrap is a Python library providing easy wrapper functions to use with
Python's functools.partial. It allows to use any external executable as well as any Python function with
arbitrary arguments and keywords to be used with libraries that call functions simply in the form func(x). This includes the functions of the scipy.optimize package or external packages such as emcee or pyeee, and allows the use of distributed
function evaluations with Python's multiprocessing or via MPI.

 

The current release fixes the substitution functions for a more general use, i.e. it respects spaces and replaces all non-space characters on the right-hand side of the equal sign.
